articles.title: Leeds will hope Jesse Marsch can avoid becoming the American punchline like Bob Bradley - Football365
articles.description: Bob Bradley was doomed as soon as he said "road games". Jesse Marsch has a precedent not to follow.
articles.content:
“I think there’s probably a stigma. I’m not sure ‘Ted Lasso’ helped. I haven’t watched the show, but I get it.”

articles.title: World Cup winner Roberto Carlos scores penalty as he makes SUNDAY LEAGUE appearance at the age of 48 - Daily Mail
articles.description: Brazil and Real Madrid legend Roberto Carlos ran out on to a village hall pitch in Shropshire to make his English debut for a Sunday League pub team - Bull in the Barne United - against Harlescott Rangers.
articles.content:
As a World Cup winner he regularly played in front of crowds of 80,000 in football's biggest stadiums.
